p: Since its introduction in the seventeenth century, YF remained in the Amazonian region in the form of a jungle cycle that causes rural, peri-urban or urban epidemics at regular intervals. The sylvatic cycle is maintained by wild endemic vectors present before the introduction of YF in Brazil – belonging to the genera Haemagogus and Sabethes – playing the role of virus reservoir, especially in the Amazon that is the refuge zone of the virus [ 3, 79– 83]. Extension to peri-urban and urban areas involves A. albopictus and A. aegypti respectively, and follows the routes of human migrations, particularly forest galleries [ 4].
